  sgcool_label_text: This instructional booklet teaches Chinese speakers the basics of the Malay language. It was published by the Dewan Bahasa Dan Kebudayaan Kebangsaan (DBKK)
 or Institute of National Language and Culture
 which was established in 1960. This was part of the government’s larger initiative to promote Malay as the national language
 as well as a Malayan culture. Besides publications
 the DBKK also organised a National Language week
 conferences for writers
 competitions
 exhibitions and cultural shows among other events to promote the national language.   This instructional booklet teaches Chinese speakers the basics of the Malay language. It was published by the Dewan Bahasa Dan Kebudayaan Kebangsaan (DBKK)
 or Institute of National Language and Culture
 which was established in 1960. This was part of the government’s larger initiative to promote Malay as the national language

 the DBKK also organised a National Language week
 conferences for writers

 exhibitions and cultural shows among other events to promote the national language.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This instructional booklet teaches Chinese speakers the basics of the Malay language. It was published by the Dewan Bahasa Dan Kebudayaan Kebangsaan (DBKK), or Institute of National Language and Culture, which was established in 1960. This was part of the government’s larger initiative to promote Malay as the national language, as well as a Malayan culture. Besides publications, the DBKK also organised a National Language week, conferences for writers, competitions, exhibitions and cultural shows among other events to promote the national language.   This instructional booklet teaches Chinese speakers the basics of the Malay language. It was published by the Dewan Bahasa Dan Kebudayaan Kebangsaan (DBKK), or Institute of National Language and Culture, which was established in 1960. This was part of the government’s larger initiative to promote Malay as the national language, as well as a Malayan culture. Besides publications, the DBKK also organised a National Language week, conferences for writers, competitions, exhibitions and cultural shows among other events to promote the national language.
